tourist_spots.name: Taj Mahal
tourist_spots.description: A magnificent white marble mausoleum built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal.

tourist_spots.name: Jaipur City Palace
tourist_spots.description: A royal residence known for its stunning architecture, including courtyards, gardens, and museums.

tourist_spots.name: Qutub Minar
tourist_spots.description: A UNESCO World Heritage site, this 73-meter tall minaret is an example of early Indo-Islamic architecture.

tourist_spots.name: Gateway of India
tourist_spots.description: An iconic monument built during the British Raj, located on the waterfront in Mumbai.

tourist_spots.name: Red Fort
tourist_spots.description: A historic fortification and a symbol of India's rich heritage, built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan.

tourist_spots.name: Hampi
tourist_spots.description: A UNESCO World Heritage site known for its ancient temples, ruins, and stunning landscapes.

tourist_spots.name: Sydney Opera House
tourist_spots.description: An iconic performing arts center known for its unique architecture and cultural significance.

tourist_spots.name: Great Barrier Reef
tourist_spots.description: The world's largest coral reef system, renowned for its marine biodiversity.

tourist_spots.name: Uluru
tourist_spots.description: A massive sandstone monolith, sacred to Indigenous Australians and famous for its changing colors.

tourist_spots.name: Bondi Beach
tourist_spots.description: A famous beach known for its surfing and vibrant coastal atmosphere.

tourist_spots.name: Great Ocean Road
tourist_spots.description: A scenic coastal drive known for its stunning views and the Twelve Apostles rock formations.

tourist_spots.name: Kakadu National Park
tourist_spots.description: A UNESCO World Heritage site known for its diverse ecosystems and Aboriginal rock art.

tourist_spots.name: Tasmania's Wilderness
tourist_spots.description: An area known for its pristine natural landscapes and unique wildlife.

tourist_spots.name: Melbourne's Laneways
tourist_spots.description: A network of alleyways famous for their street art, cafes, and boutique shops.

tourist_spots.name: Eiffel Tower
tourist_spots.description: A wrought-iron lattice tower built by Gustave Eiffel for the 1889 Exposition Universelle.

tourist_spots.name: Louvre Museum
tourist_spots.description: The world's largest art museum and a historic monument in Paris, France.

tourist_spots.name: Versailles Palace
tourist_spots.description: A royal château known for its opulent architecture and gardens.

tourist_spots.name: Notre-Dame Cathedral
tourist_spots.description: A medieval Catholic cathedral known for its Gothic architecture and history.

tourist_spots.name: Mont Saint-Michel
tourist_spots.description: A small rocky island with a stunning abbey, known for its unique tides.

tourist_spots.name: Sainte-Chapelle
tourist_spots.description: A Gothic chapel known for its magnificent stained glass windows.

tourist_spots.name: Panthéon
tourist_spots.description: A mausoleum and former church housing the remains of notable French figures.

tourist_spots.name: Luxembourg Gardens
tourist_spots.description: A beautiful garden and park known for its French formal garden design.

tourist_spots.name: Colosseum
tourist_spots.description: An ancient amphitheater known for its gladiatorial contests and public spectacles.

tourist_spots.name: Vatican City
tourist_spots.description: The independent city-state home to the Pope and famous landmarks like St. Peter's Basilica.

tourist_spots.name: Leaning Tower of Pisa
tourist_spots.description: A freestanding bell tower known for its unintended tilt.

tourist_spots.name: Trevi Fountain
tourist_spots.description: A Baroque fountain known for its stunning sculptures and tradition of coin throwing.

tourist_spots.name: Florence Cathedral
tourist_spots.description: A Renaissance cathedral with a striking dome designed by Brunelleschi.

tourist_spots.name: Cinque Terre
tourist_spots.description: A picturesque coastal region known for its colorful villages and dramatic landscapes.

tourist_spots.name: Pompeii
tourist_spots.description: An ancient Roman city preserved by the eruption of Mount Vesuvius.

tourist_spots.name: Siena's Piazza del Campo
tourist_spots.description: A famous medieval square known for its shell shape and annual horse race.

tourist_spots.name: Statue of Liberty
tourist_spots.description: A symbol of freedom and democracy, located on Liberty Island.

tourist_spots.name: Grand Canyon
tourist_spots.description: A vast and impressive canyon known for its stunning natural beauty and geological significance.

tourist_spots.name: Yellowstone National Park
tourist_spots.description: The first national park in the world, known for its geothermal features and diverse wildlife.

tourist_spots.name: Niagara Falls
tourist_spots.description: A set of massive waterfalls known for their breathtaking views and power.

tourist_spots.name: Yosemite National Park
tourist_spots.description: A park famous for its stunning granite cliffs, waterfalls, and giant sequoias.

tourist_spots.name: Golden Gate Bridge
tourist_spots.description: An iconic suspension bridge known for its striking orange color and panoramic views.

tourist_spots.name: Las Vegas Strip
tourist_spots.description: A famous stretch of Las Vegas Boulevard known for its casinos and entertainment.

tourist_spots.name: Miami Beach
tourist_spots.description: A popular destination known for its beautiful beaches and vibrant nightlife.

tourist_spots.name: Christ the Redeemer
tourist_spots.description: A large statue of Jesus Christ overlooking the city, known for its iconic design and panoramic views.

tourist_spots.name: Sugarloaf Mountain
tourist_spots.description: A peak with a cable car offering spectacular views of the city and bay.

tourist_spots.name: Iguazu Falls
tourist_spots.description: A massive waterfall system on the border with Argentina, known for its breathtaking size and power.

tourist_spots.name: Amazon Rainforest
tourist_spots.description: The largest tropical rainforest in the world, known for its incredible biodiversity.

tourist_spots.name: Pantanal
tourist_spots.description: The world's largest tropical wetland, renowned for its wildlife and birdwatching.

tourist_spots.name: Copacabana Beach
tourist_spots.description: A famous beach known for its lively atmosphere and scenic beauty.

tourist_spots.name: Salvador's Pelourinho
tourist_spots.description: A historic district known for its colorful colonial buildings and Afro-Brazilian culture.

tourist_spots.name: Ouro Preto
tourist_spots.description: A historic town known for its well-preserved colonial architecture and mining history.

tourist_spots.name: Mount Fuji
tourist_spots.description: Japan's highest peak, known for its iconic, symmetrical volcanic cone.

tourist_spots.name: Tokyo Disneyland
tourist_spots.description: A popular theme park with attractions based on Disney characters and stories.

tourist_spots.name: Fushimi Inari Shrine
tourist_spots.description: Famous for its thousands of vermilion torii gates leading up to the shrine's mountaintop.

tourist_spots.name: Kyoto's Golden Pavilion
tourist_spots.description: A stunning Zen Buddhist temple covered in gold leaf and set in beautiful gardens.

tourist_spots.name: Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park
tourist_spots.description: A memorial park dedicated to the victims of the atomic bomb in 1945.

tourist_spots.name: Shibuya Crossing
tourist_spots.description: One of the world's busiest pedestrian crossings and a vibrant area of Tokyo.

tourist_spots.name: Nara Park
tourist_spots.description: A large park known for its free-roaming deer and historic temples.

tourist_spots.name: Odaiba
tourist_spots.description: A futuristic entertainment and shopping district on a man-made island in Tokyo Bay.
